description:
From Latin incubātus, past participle of
incubāre (“to hatch”), from Latin
in- (“on”) and cubāre (“to lie”).

verbs.description: incubate (third-person singular simple present incubates, present participle incubating, simple past and past participle incubated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To brood, raise, or maintain eggs, organisms, or living tissue through the provision of ideal environmental conditions.
(transitive, figurative) To incubate metaphorically; to ponder an idea slowly and deliberately as if in preparation for hatching it.
